How far up its own ass does the American government need to be to allow a piece of man-made equipment to leak fuel into the ocean on behalf of a memorial?
Everyone who is saying that "these aren't harmful levels" doesn't understand how fragile marine life actually is. It's admittedly not an active environmental disaster, but to leave a potential health hazard just sitting in the ocean like that is foolhardy, shortsighted, and arrogant. https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/massive-oil-plume-pearl-harbor_us_55fc63d8e4b08820d91891ed

Everyone worried about that pollution... what do you propose they do? Any action anyone can think of will simply relocate the pollution or convert it into another pollutant. Think about it. You can somehow pump all the fuel out of a rusted sunken ship. Now what? The fuel isn't usable as old as it is. You could burn it (maybe) but that would just create carbon and other pollutants. You could put it in a tank and relocate the tank. Then what? Bury the tank somewhere? It will also leak eventually.

Calm down people. These 5 gallons are literally a drop in a bucket compared to how much fuel is leaked into the ocean every year from ships even if you don't count accidental spills. A slow 5 gallon per year leak is absolutely negligible on the environment compared to any action to contain or remove it.
